column1: My wallet was stolen today... this is the first time Ive been sad after losing five pounds.
column3: The word pounds refers to both money (currency) and weight.
column4: I lost five pounds after following a strict diet this month.
column5: The exchange rate means I only have five pounds left in my wallet.

column1: What did they say when Jett passed out drunk at a party? Jett crashed.
column3: Crashed can refer to someone falling asleep or fainting, or to a vehicle collision.
column4: The airplane crashed shortly after takeoff due to technical failure.
column5: After a long day, I crashed on the sofa as soon as I got home.

column1: What is the definition of a farmer!? someone who is out-standing in his field!
column3: Field can refer to an area of land for farming and also a domain of study or expertise.
column4: The farmer worked hard to maintain his field throughout the summer.
column5: She decided to pursue a career in the field of neuroscience.

column1: Note: Each entry separates the joke context, word, explanation, and new sentences distinctively.
